evidence.text: i. Grant such other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Grant such other relief as the Court deems necessary, just, and proper.

evidence.text: a. Declare unlawful Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program, including but not limited to the issuance of termination and non-renewal notices by DOL starting on May 29, 2025;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare unlawful Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program, including but not limited to the issuance of termination and non-renewal notices by DOL starting on May 29, 2025;

evidence.text: b. Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are arbitrary and capricious, in excess of statutory authority, and a violation of the Administrative Procedure Act;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are arbitrary and capricious, in excess of statutory authority, and a violation of the Administrative Procedure Act;

evidence.text: c. Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are ultra vires;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program are ultra vires;

evidence.text: d. Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program violate the separation of powers;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Declare that Defendants’ actions eliminating the Job Corps program violate the separation of powers;

evidence.text: e. Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the elimination of the Job Corps program, including the stop work orders and termination and non-renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to the elimination of the Job Corps program, including the stop work orders and termination and non-renewal notices delivered to Job Corps center operators starting May 29, 2025;

evidence.text: f. Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals; and

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from issuing, enforcing, implementing, maintaining or giving effect to any shutdown tasks, job terminations, or student removals;

evidence.text: g. Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization;

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from taking any further action to eliminate the Job Corps program without Congressional authorization;

evidence.text: h. Award Plaintiffs costs, reasonable attorneys’ fees, and other disbursements as appropriate; and

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Award Plaintiffs costs, reasonable attorneys’ fees, and other disbursements as appropriate;
